title: TPS62180 Alternative?
message: Hi all, I have an 820-01598 that came in no power, 5v 0.01a. Missing PP3V3_G3H_RTC and the area around U6903 and the chip itself are gross. Only problem is, I don't have a donor and Mouser + DigiKey are both out of stock. Suppose I could order from Aliexpress but the closer the better. Any other ideas where to pick some of these up, or any other compatible chips that would work in it's spot?

title: TPS62180 Alternative?
message:
Other boards use it, like 00850, 01041; maybe more models.
If not, go for Aliexpress and buy few to have in stock.

title: TPS62180 Alternative?
message:
Have an update on this one. Got the chips in and replaced U6903, rebuilt the area around it from a donor as most of the components were nasty. USB meter now shows 5V 0.05-0.06A. Nothing on the chip has a diode reading under 400 so nothing seems shorted, but  PP3V3_G3H_RTC goes up to 3v and then drops down and cycles over and over. PPBUS does the same. What other rails could be shorted in this case? Other than this one spot the board is clear of liquid damage.

Diode:
PPBUS_G3H: 442
PP3V3_G3H_RTC: 405
PP3V3_G3H: 544

title: TPS62180 Alternative?
message: Getting 1.3ohms resistance/001 diode on PP1V8_SLPS2R. Does this signal originate from the T2 on this board?

title: TPS62180 Alternative?
message:
You should get steady PPBUS_G3H, even with only 5V on USB-C input.
Check what happens if a good battery (holding some charge) is connected.

If you remove R6934/35, PPBUS_G3H still drops?

title: TPS62180 Alternative?
message: With R6934/35 off, PPBUS is stable 12.29v. Will have to do some more investigating in the U6903 area.

title: TPS62180 Alternative?
message: I'm also now getting a stable 3.3v at C6912

title: TPS62180 Alternative?
message: Apart of 1V8_SLPS2R, do you note short on any other coil around U7800?

title: TPS62180 Alternative?
message: L7410 seems to be as well, I'm getting 4ohms in resistance mode

title: TPS62180 Alternative?
message:
I was talking about the small coils surrounding U7800.
L7410 is for iGPU.
